sen.j: 伏見宮（ふしみのみや）は、日本の宮家の一つ。
sen.e: Fushimi no Miya is the one of the princely house.
Fushimi no Miya is the one of the princely houses.
Fushimi no Miya is one of the Miyake (house of imperial prince).
sen.cmt: the削除"princely houses"→"Miyake (hous of imperial prince) "に変更しました。

sen.j: 四世襲親王家の一つ。
sen.e: One of the four hereditary Imperial Prince's family.
One of the four hereditary Imperial Prince's families.
One of the four hereditary Imperial Prince's families.

tit.cmt: 他ファイルに合わせる

sen.j: 菊の花を裏から見た様子を描いた裏菊を家紋とし、家紋同様に天皇家とは深い繋がりのある宮家であった。
sen.e: Fushimi no miya had a deep relationship with the Imperial family and has the crest of a family which is the picture of a chrysanthemum drew from the wrong side of the flower.
Fushimi no miya had a deep relationship with the Imperial family and has the crest of a family, the picture of the chrysanthemum, drawn from the wrong view of the flower.
Fushimi no Miya had a deep relationship with the Imperial family and has the crest of a family, the picture of the chrysanthemum, drawn from the wrong view of the flower.

sen.j: 北朝第3代崇光天皇の皇子、伏見宮栄仁親王（よしひと、なかひと）が始祖。
sen.e: The founder of Fushimi no Miya was the third Emperor Suko's Prince of the Northern Dynasty, Fushimi no Miya Imperial Prince Yoshihito, Nakahito and others.
The founder of Fushimi no Miya was the third Emperor Suko's Prince of the Northern Dynasty, Fushimi no Miya Imperial Prince Yoshihito, Nakahito and other names.
The founder of Fushimi no Miya was the third Emperor Suko's Prince of the Northern Court, Fushimi no Miya Imperial Prince Yoshihito (Nakahito).
sen.cmt: Nakahito and other names→(Nakahito)Northern Dynasty→Northern Courtに変更しました。

sen.j: 明治維新後に創設された宮家は、ほとんど伏見宮家の系統である。
sen.e: Most of the princely houses founded after the Meiji restoration were Fushimi no Miya's family line.
Most of the princely houses founded after the Meiji restoration were Fushimi no Miya's family line.
Most of the Miyake founded after the Meiji Restoration were Fushimi no Miya's family line.

sen.j: 現在の天皇家も伏見宮家の系統であり、伏見宮貞成親王の男系子孫である。
sen.e: The current Imperial family as well is from Fushimi no Miya line, they are the male descendant of Fushimi no Miya Imperial Prince Sadafusa.
The current Imperial family, as well, is from the Fushimi no Miya line, they are from the male descendant of Fushimi no Miya Imperial Prince Sadafusa.
The current Imperial family, as well, is from the Fushimi no Miya line, they are from the male descendant of Fushimi no Miya Imperial Prince Sadafusa.

sen.j: 元来、伏見宮家は持明院統の嫡流にあたるが、伏見宮栄仁親王の皇位継承は将軍足利義満に忌避されたと考えられる。
sen.e: Originally Fushimi no Miya family was the direct line of the Jimyo-in Imperial line, it is considered the Fushimi no Miya Prince Yoshihito, Nakahito's Imperial succession was Fushimi no Miya descent was refused by Yoshimitsu ASHIKAGA.

Originally, the Fushimi no Miya family was the direct line from the Jimyo-in Imperial line, it is considered that the Fushimi no Miya Prince Yoshihito, Nakahito's Imperial succession was Fushimi no Miya descent that was refused by Yoshimitsu ASHIKAGA.

Originally, the Fushimi no Miya family was the direct line from the Jimyo-in Imperial line, it is considered that the Fushimi no Miya Prince Yoshihito's Imperial succession was refused by Yoshimitsu ASHIKAGA.
sen.cmt: , Nakahito削除Fushimi no Miya descent that was 削除

sen.j: 伏見宮の宮号は、宮家の所領・伏見御領にちなんだものである。
sen.e: The Miya go (the title given by the emperor to the house owner) came from the name of princely house's private land or the land belong to Fushimi family.
The Miya go (the title given by the emperor to the house owner) came from the name of the princely house's private land or the land belonging to the Fushimi family.
The Miya go (the title given by the emperor to the house owner) of Fushimi no Miya came from the name of the Miyake's private land or the land belonging to the Fushimi family.
sen.cmt: of Fushimi no Miya補足"princely house's"→"Miyake's "に変更しました。

sen.j: 栄仁親王の子の3代伏見宮貞成親王は、自ら伏見宮と称していた。
sen.e: Imperial Prince Yoshihito, Nakahito's third Prince, Fushimi no Miya Imperial Prince Sadafusa called himself Fushimi no Miya.
Imperial Prince Yoshihito, Nakahito's third Prince, Fushimi no Miya Imperial Prince Sadafusa called himself Fushimi no Miya.
Imperial Prince Yoshihito's third Prince, Fushimi no Miya Imperial Prince Sadafusa called himself Fushimi no Miya.

sen.j: 貞成親王の子の4代伏見宮貞常親王は、後花園天皇（貞成親王の子で貞常親王の兄）から、永世、伏見殿と称することを勅許され、以後、代々、伏見宮と名乗るようになった。
sen.e: Imperial Prince Sadafusa's fourth Prince and his son, Fushimi no Miya Imperial Prince Sadatsune had an Imperial order from Emperor Gohanazono (Prince Sadafusa's child and Prince Sadatsune's older brother) to name Fushimi dono permanently since then the family named Fushimi no Miya for generations.
sen.cmt: 伏見殿 → fushimi dono, Fushimi den 読み方不明でした。
sen.e: Imperial Prince Sadafusa's fourth Prince and his son, Fushimi no Miya Imperial Prince Sadatsune had an Imperial order from Emperor Gohanazono (Prince Sadafusa's child and Prince Sadatsune's older brother) to name Fushimi dono permanently and since then the family was named Fushimi no Miya for generations.

Imperial Prince Sadafusa's fourth Prince and his son, Fushimi no Miya Imperial Prince Sadatsune had an Imperial order from Emperor Gohanazono (Imperial Prince Sadafusa's child and Imperial Prince Sadatsune's older brother) to name Fushimi dono permanently and since then the family was named Fushimi no Miya for generations.
sen.cmt: "Prince Sadafusa"→"Imperial Prince Sadafusa"に変更しました。"Prince Sadatsune"→"Imperial Prince Sadatsune"に変更しました。

sen.j: 現皇室の 本宗にあたると考えられたためか、他の宮家が次々断絶していく中、どの時代にも、常に大切にされ、守られてきたと認められる。
sen.e: The Fushimi no Miya family might have been considered the original family line of current Imperial family, they are treated well and protected during any period although other princely houses became extinguished.
sen.cmt: 本宗→不明[本家（original family) の意]
sen.e: The Fushimi no Miya family might have been considered the original family line of the current Imperial family, they were treated well and protected during all periods although other princely houses were eliminated.

The Fushimi no Miya family might have been considered the original family line of the current Imperial family, they were treated well and protected during all periods although other Miyake were eliminated.

sen.j: 幕末・明治維新の時の19代伏見宮貞敬親王および20代・23代伏見宮邦家親王は子女に恵まれ、貞敬親王からは、梨本宮、邦家親王からは、山階宮、久邇宮、華頂宮、小松宮、北白川宮、東伏見宮がそれぞれ創設された。
sen.e: The nineteenth Fushimi no Miya Imperial Prince Sadayoshi and the twentieth, twenty third Fushimi no Miya Imperial Prince Kuniie had children, during end of the Kamakura bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a Shogun) and Meiji Restoration, there was Nashimoto no Miya from Imperial Prince Sadayoshi, and Yamashina no Miya, Kuni no Miya, Komatsu no Miya, Kitashirakawa no Miya, Higashifushimi no Miya from Imperial Prince Kuniie, were established.

The nineteenth Fushimi no Miya Imperial Prince Sadayoshi and the twentieth, twenty third Fushimi no Miya Imperial Prince Kuniie had children, during the end of the Kamakura bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a Shogun) and Meiji Restoration, there was Nashimoto no Miya from the Imperial Prince Sadayoshi, and Yamashina no Miya, Kuni no Miya, Komatsu no Miya, Kitashirakawa no Miya, Higashifushimi no Miya from Imperial Prince Kuniie, were established.

The nineteenth Fushimi no Miya Imperial Prince Sadayoshi and the twentieth, twenty third Fushimi no Miya Imperial Prince Kuniie had children, during the end of the Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a Shogun) and Meiji Restoration, there was Nashimoto no Miya from the Imperial Prince Sadayoshi, and Yamashina no Miya, Kuni no Miya, Kacho no Miya, Komatsu no Miya, Kitashirakawa no Miya, Higashifushimi no Miya from Imperial Prince Kuniie, were established.

sen.j: 明治維新後は、邦家親王の跡を継いだ24代伏見宮貞愛親王は、元帥、陸軍大将に累進。
sen.e: After the Meiji Restoration, twenty fourth Fushimi no Miya Imperial Prince Sadanaru took over Imperial Prince Kuniie, he became a general of the army and a military general.
After the Meiji Restoration, the twenty fourth Fushimi no Miya Imperial Prince Sadanaru took over from Imperial Prince Kuniie, he became a general of the army.
After the Meiji Restoration, the twenty fourth Fushimi no Miya Imperial Prince Sadanaru took over from Imperial Prince Kuniie, he became a general of the army.

sen.j: 明治天皇および大正天皇の御信任も厚く、皇族の重鎮として、大日本農会、在郷軍人会総裁を歴任した。
sen.e: The family had trust from Emperor Meiji and Emperor Taisho, they successively held the position of Dai Nihon Agricultural Association and the President of the association of reservists as leading figure of the Imperial family.

The family was trusted by Emperor Meiji and Emperor Taisho, they successively held the position of Dai Nihon Agricultural Association and the President of the association of reservists as the leading figure of the Imperial family.

The family was trusted by Emperor Meiji and Emperor Taisho, they successively held the position of Dai Nihon Agricultural Association and the President of the association of reservists as the leading figure of the Imperial family.

sen.j: 貞愛親王の跡を継いだのが、25代伏見宮博恭王である。
sen.e: The twenty fifth Fushimi no Miya Prince Hiroyasu took over Imperial Prince Sadanaru.
The twenty fifth Fushimi no Miya Prince Hiroyasu took over from Imperial Prince Sadanaru.
The twenty fifth Fushimi no Miya Prince Hiroyasu took over from Imperial Prince Sadanaru.

sen.j: 博恭王は当初、華頂宮家を継承していたが、伏見宮家の継嗣とされていた弟の邦芳王が病弱のため、伏見宮に復帰して継嗣となった。
sen.e: Initially Prince Hiroyasu succeeded Kacho no Miya family, however his younger brother and the successor of the Fushimi no Miya family, Prince Kunika was not well, Prince Hiroyasu returned to Fushimi no Miya to take over the family name.

Initially Prince Hiroyasu succeeded the Kacho no Miya family, however his younger brother and successor of the Fushimi no Miya family, Prince Kunika was not well, Prince Hiroyasu returned to Fushimi no Miya to take over the family name.

Initially Prince Hiroyasu succeeded the Kacho no Miya family, however his younger brother and successor of the Fushimi no Miya family, Prince Kunika was not well, Prince Hiroyasu returned to Fushimi no Miya to take over the family name.

sen.j: 元帥・海軍大将・軍令部総長として昭和海軍の実力者であった。
sen.e: He was a person in power of the navy in Showa period acted as a military general, general of the navy and a military commander and a chancellor.
sen.cmt: 軍令部総長→the President of the Naval General Staff[定訳不明]
sen.e: He was a person in power of the navy iduring the Showa period, acted as a military general, general of the navy and a military commander and a chancellor.
He was a person in power of the navy during the Showa period, acted as a military general, general of the navy and a military commander and a chancellor.

sen.j: 博恭王は、昭和21年8月16日薨去し、博恭王の第一王子の博義王は父よりも早く薨去していたので、博義王の第一王子である伏見宮博明王が26代となった。
sen.e: Prince Hiroyasu died on August 16th, Showa 21 and his fist Prince, Prince Hiroyoshi died before his father, thus Hiroyoshi's first Prince, Fushimi no Miya Prince Hiroaki represented twenty sixth Fushimi no Miya.

Prince Hiroyasu died on August 16th, Showa 21 and his fist Prince, Prince Hiroyoshi died before his father, thus Hiroyoshi's first Prince, Fushimi no Miya Prince Hiroaki represented the twenty sixth Fushimi no Miya.

Prince Hiroyasu died on August 16, 1946 and his first Prince, Prince Hiroyoshi died before his father, thus Hiroyoshi's first Prince, Fushimi no Miya Prince Hiroaki represented the twenty sixth Fushimi no Miya.

sen.j: 博明王は昭和22年10月14日の皇籍離脱により、伏見氏を名乗る。
sen.e: Prince Hiroaki named as Fushimi no Miya family after Koseki Ridatsu (ceasing to be a member of the Imperial family) on October 14th, Showa 22.
Prince Hiroaki was named as Fushimi no Miya family after Koseki Ridatsu (ceasing to be a member of the Imperial family) on October 14th, Showa 22.
Prince Hiroaki was named as Fushimi no Miya family after Koseki Ridatsu (ceasing to be a member of the Imperial family) on October 14, 1947.

sen.j: 伏見宮邸跡地は、現在はホテルニューオータニとなっており、庭園にその名残がある。
sen.e: Fushimi no Miya used be at where current Hotel New Otani is, and there is a relic of the Fushimi no Miya family in the garden.
Fushimi no Miya used be where current Hotel New Otani is, and there is a relic of the Fushimi no Miya family in the garden.
Fushimi no Miya used to be where current Hotel New Otani is, and there is a relic of the Fushimi no Miya family in the garden.

sen.j: なおこの場所には、はじめ加藤清正の下屋敷があり、後には井伊家中屋敷があった。
sen.e: Initially there used to be Kiyomasa KATO's villa and later there was the second city residence of the Ii family.
sen.cmt: 井伊家中屋敷→the second city residence of the Ii Family[定訳不明]
sen.e: Initially there used to be Kiyomasa KATO's villa and later there was the second city residence of the Ii family.
Initially there used to be Kiyomasa KATO's villa and later there was the second city residence of the Ii family.

sen.j: ※正確には、邦家親王→貞教親王→貞愛親王→邦家親王（再継承）→貞愛親王（再継承）→博恭王という継承が行われた。
sen.e: *Strictly speaking, the Imperial succession order was as follows; Imperial Prince Kuniie=> Imperial Prince Sadayoshi=> Imperial Prince Sadanaru=> Imperial Prince Kuniie (re-succession)=> Imperial Prince Sadanaru (re-succession)=> Prince Hiroyasu

*Strictly speaking, the Imperial succession order was as follows; Imperial Prince Kuniie=> Imperial Prince Sadayoshi=> Imperial Prince Sadanaru=> Imperial Prince Kuniie (re-succession)=> Imperial Prince Sadanaru (re-succession)=> Prince Hiroyasu

*Strictly speaking, the Imperial succession order was as follows; Imperial Prince Kuniie=>Imperial Prince Sadayoshi=>Imperial Prince Sadanaru=>Imperial Prince Kuniie (re-succession)=>Imperial Prince Sadanaru (re-succession)=>Prince Hiroyasu

sen.j: そのため、系図によっては邦家親王を20代・23代、貞愛親王を22代・24代、博恭王を25代と数えているものもある。
sen.e: Thus Imperial Prince Kuniie is considered as twentieth, twenty third, Imperial Prince Sadanaru as twenty second, twenty fourth, Prince Hiroyasu as twenty fifth of Fushimi no Miya family in some family tree.

Thus Imperial Prince Kuniie is considered as twentieth, twenty third, Imperial Prince Sadanaru as twenty second, twenty fourth, Prince Hiroyasu as twenty fifth of Fushimi no Miya family in some family tree.

Thus Imperial Prince Kuniie is considered as twentieth, twenty third, Imperial Prince Sadanaru as twenty second, twenty fourth, Prince Hiroyasu as twenty fifth of Fushimi no Miya family in some family tree.

sen.j: また11代邦尚親王については、その父である10代貞清親王よりも7か月早く薨去しているので歴代当主に数えない説もある。
sen.e: In relation to the eleventh Imperial Prince Kuninao, since he died seven month earlier than his father, Imperial Prince Hiroyoshi, thus Kuninao is not included in successive Fushimi no Miya family.

In relation to the eleventh Imperial Prince Kuninao, since he died seven month earlier than his father, Imperial Prince Hiroyoshi, thus Kuninao is not included in the successive Fushimi no Miya family.

In relation to the eleventh Imperial Prince Kuninao, since he died seven month earlier than his father, Imperial Prince Hiroyoshi, thus Kuninao is not included in the successive Fushimi no Miya family.

sen.j: 同様に24代博明王の父の博義王については、その父である23代博恭王よりも早く薨去しているが、博義王については歴代当主に数えていない資料が多い。
sen.e: In the same way Prince Hiroaki's father, Prince Hiroyoshi died before his father, twenty third Prince Hiroyasu, Prince Hiroyoshi was not included in the successive head of the family in many materials.

In the same way Prince Hiroaki's father, Prince Hiroyoshi died before his father, twenty third Prince Hiroyasu, Prince Hiroyoshi was not included in the successive head of the family in many written materials.

In the same way twenty fourth Prince Hiroaki's father, Prince Hiroyoshi died before his father, twenty third Prince Hiroyasu, Prince Hiroyoshi was not included in the successive head of the family in many written materials.
